column2: Description
A science museum — and scientific and educational institution — located in San Francisco's Golden Gate Park.
Aims to rehabilitate adult offenders to promote community safety and reduce recidivism.
SFO is the Bay Area’s largest airport by passenger volume. The Commission sets its policies.
The Commission champions the arts, invests in local artists, enlivens the urban environment, and shapes innovative cultural policy.
The museum celebrates, preserves, and promotes Asian and Asian American art and cultures.
Aims to identify and assess all taxable property in the city, collect transfer tax, and record and provide access to records.
Provides a final administrative review process for appeals on a range of City determinations.
The legislative branch of San Francisco’s government. It adopts legislation, establishes policies, and assists constituents.
Oversees the enforcement of various building codes and Disability Access Regulations.
Aims to improve the city for children by investing in youth and their families.
Aims to ensure the financial support and well-being of children through child support orders and non-cash alternatives.
Provides legal services to the Mayor’s Office, the Board of Supervisors, elected City officials, and all the city’s departments, boards, and commissions.
Aims to guide and regulate land use, urban design, and development to make San Francisco the world’s most livable urban place.
Aims to make sure the city employs the best-qualified candidates for public service in a timely and efficient manner.
Aims to ensure the City’s financial integrity through audits and oversight, promoting effective and accountable government.
Aims to hold the police accountable to civilian oversight through investigations, policy recommendations, and performance audits.
Helps parents and guardians with child care, parenting support, and child development.
Aims to prosecute suspects, support victims of crime, and develop alternatives to incarceration.
Aims to support sustainable jobs and businesses using grants, work training, and more.
Aims to provide equitable access to election services and voting, and to conduct free and fair elections.
Leads in planning, preparedness, communication, response, and recovery for daily emergencies, citywide events, and major disasters.
Provides support for urban agriculture, forestry, green buildings, and other environmental projects.
Investigates and punishes wrongdoing in the city, and collects and reports electoral data.
Aims to connect visitors with art to stimulate creativity and share knowledge and ideas.
Aims to protect lives and property from fires, natural disasters, accidents, hazardous materials incidents, and other causes.
General City Responsibility Expenditures not directly attributable to one City department, such as reserve deposits and debt service.
A broad array of departments, divisions, programs, and offices reporting to the Office of the City Administrator.
A broad array of departments, divisions, programs, and offices with the aim of improving city tech.
Aims to preserve and improve health benefits and to enhance the well-being of employees, retirees, and their families.
Aims to make homelessness rare, brief, and one-time through services like housing and mental health support.
Aims to use equitable practices to hire, develop, support, and retain a highly-qualified workforce.
Advocates for human and civil rights, and uses anti-discrimination laws to further racial solidarity and equity.
Delivers services to support communities including food distribution, children's programs, and a disability community center.
Aims to rehabilitate young offenders by providing supervision, support, and resources.
Provides free legal information resources and services to help residents understand the law and protect their legal rights.
The executive branch of San Francisco's government. Has a broad remit for enacting programs and setting policy direction.
Aims to make transit and other sustainable modes of travel safe, affordable, and attractive.
Aims to prevent and investigate crimes, ensure public safety, and maintain respect for all.
Aims to advance sustainable maritime, recreational, and economic opportunities via the port.
Offers free legal representation and advocates for systemic changes to benefit the disenfranchised and disempowered.
Aims to protect and promote health through hospital funding, housing programs, mental health investment, and more.
Provides free and equal access to books and digital services throughout the city.
Provides reliable water, power, and wastewater services to the city.
Builds and maintains city infrastructure, such as streets and sidewalks.
Provides the city's parks, playgrounds, and open spaces, as well as enriching recreational activities.
Aims to protect tenants from excessive rent increases and unjust evictions, while assuring landlords fair rents.
Works to secure and prudently invest the city's pension trust accounts and provide promised benefits.
Provides independent civilian oversight of the Sheriff's Office.
Operates jails and alternative sentencing programs, guards courthouses, and executes warrants.
Aims to make the city fully gender equitable through policies, programs, and legislation.
Aims to assure equal access, fair treatment, and the just and efficient resolution of disputes for all people asserting their rights under the law in the city.
The banker, tax collector, collection agent, and investment officer for the city.
The War Memorial and Performing Arts Center operates venues for culture, education, and entertainment.
